description: Contractors owed tens of millions of dollars by USAID are warning they may have to shut down and risk lawsuits across the developing world, with one large firm even saying US banks won’t lend it more money over concerns the US government won’t honor its funding commitments.
title: USAID Contractors Warn of Shutdowns, Lawsuits With Millions Owed

description: The US Commodity Futures Trading Commission will formally evaluate how companies or individuals accused of wrongdoing cooperate or self-report before levying fines, the latest signal the derivatives regulator is shifting its approach to enforcement.
title: CFTC Plans to Curtail Fines for Alleged Wrongdoers Who Cooperate

description: China’s National People’s Congress will begin its annual meeting on March 5, giving leaders a chance to set the economic direction and lay out spending plans for the year ahead. With Donald Trump threatening more tariffs and the Chinese economy battling deflation and a prolonged property slump, measures to boost consumer spending will be more important than ever. Investors will be paying close attention to the strength of any new stimulus and broader policy signals, particularly after the recent
title: How China Plans to Trump-Proof Its Economy as Top Lawmakers Meet

description: President Donald Trump said he is starting a program to offer residency and a path to citizenship to investors who pay $5 million, offering a new avenue for legal immigration even as he carries out a sweeping crackdown on undocumented migrants.
title: Trump to Offer ‘Gold Card’ Visas for $5 Million to the Rich

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, real economy reporter Mark Niquette looks at the state of consumer confidence. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Honeymoon With Consumers May Be Nearing an End

description: President Donald Trump signed an executive action directing the Commerce Department to examine possible copper tariffs, the latest in a string of measures aimed at imposing sector-specific levies that offer to reshape global supply chains.
title: Trump to Probe Copper Tariffs, Opening Door to New Levy on Metal

description: Colombia’s Energy Minister Andres Camacho said President Gustavo Petro accepted his resignation amid fractures within the leftist leader’s administration.
title: Colombia’s Energy Minister Resigns Amid Cabinet Infighting

description: President Donald Trump plans to sign an executive order to reinforce rules to make health care prices more transparent for patients.
title: Trump to Reinforce Rules for Health-Care Cost Transparency

description: A federal judge issued a long-term block on the Trump administration’s plan to freeze grants, loans and other payments, extending a temporary order and criticizing US officials for actions that were “irrational, imprudent, and precipitated a nationwide crisis.”
title: Judge Blocks Trump’s Plan to Freeze Grants and Loans, Citing ‘Chaos’

description: Egypt should control Gaza for as long as 15 years, and oversee a transition toward Palestinian self-governance, in exchange for payment of its external debt, Israeli opposition leader Yair Lapid said Tuesday in Washington.
title: Israel’s Lapid Says Egypt Should Control Gaza for Up to 15 Years

description: A group of workers from the US Digital Service, a White House office that was refashioned into Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency in recent weeks, have resigned in protest of the billionaire’s actions to dismantle federal agencies and dismiss workers.
title: Federal Tech Workers Quit in Protest Over Musk’s DOGE Efforts

description: New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy is looking to rein in spending as part of his budget for the upcoming year.
title: NJ Governor Proposes $58.1 Billion Budget That Slashes Spending

description: The White House said that it was taking control of picking and choosing the group of reporters able to cover President Donald Trump in limited environments like the Oval Office and Air Force One.
title: White House Says It Will Now Pick and Choose Pool Reporters

description: The UK will suspend most financial aid to Rwanda over its support for rebels seizing territory in neighboring Democratic Republic of Congo, the Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office said.
title: Britain Joins Belgium With Rwanda Aid Cut Over Congo War Claims

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer swept to power promising to raise living standards and grow the British economy. But now his premiership has an urgent and altogether different focus: preserving European security in a volatile world order upended by US President Donald Trump.
title: Trump’s Threats Push Starmer Into a More Global, Military Agenda

description: Ukraine has agreed with the US on a deal to jointly develop its critical minerals, oil and gas, people familiar with the matter said, in what the White House sees as a first step toward reaching a ceasefire with Russia.
title: Ukraine to Agree With US on Terms for Minerals Deal

description: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said that more than one million federal workers replied to an Elon Musk-led directive asking for bullet points to justify their positions and work productivity.
title: Fewer Than Half of All Federal Workers Responded to Musk Email

description: Mark Meador, President Donald Trump’s nominee to fill the third Republican seat on the five-member Federal Trade Commission, told a Senate panel the agency should focus on the tech industry and the abuse of noncompete agreements in employment contracts.
title: FTC Nominee Mark Meador Pledges to Focus on Tech, Noncompete Agreements

description: For the full experience visit: Germany’s Splintered Politics Complicates Coalition Building
title: Germany’s Splintered Politics Complicates Coalition Building

description: An Irish inquiry broadly backed the nation’s so-called bad bank over the disposal of a controversial real estate portfolio, while criticizing elements of the sale.
title: Ireland’s Bad Bank Cleared in Controversial Loan Sale Inquiry

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s decision to slash foreign aid to fund defense spending has sparked a fierce backlash within his ruling Labour Party as officials warn crucial humanitarian assistance around the world will be cut off.
title: UK’s Big Defense Boost Risks Making USAID Fallout Even Worse

description: A lack of communication amid DOGE cuts is leaving shelters, crisis hotlines and veteran housing groups fearful that essential funds won’t arrive in time.
title: Shelters Await Billions in Federal Money for Homelessness Providers

description: Parsing the latest legal fight over President Donald Trump’s rapid push to shrink the US government, there was a big question on US District Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly’s mind:
title: Judge Prods ‘Where Is Mr. Musk’ as DOGE Legal Challenges Build

description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will ask for Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s assistance to enforce sanctions on Russia when the two leaders meet this week in New Delhi.
title: EU to Seek India’s Help to Enforce Sanctions on Russia

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent continued to dismiss angst over the efforts by DOGE to shrink the federal workforce and curb public spending, saying its name doesn’t stand for the “Department of Government Elimination.”
title: Bessent Says DOGE Push Isn’t About ‘Government Elimination’

description: The US trade group representing restaurants urged President Donald Trump to spare food and drinks from tariffs, estimating the levies could cost the industry more than $12 billion and lead to higher prices for consumers.
title: Restaurants Warn of Potential $12 Billion Hit From Trump Tariffs

description: President Donald Trump’s aggressive plans to shake up how the US trades with the rest of the world have fueled speculation about the potential for a grand multinational bargain that would deliberately weaken the dollar — helping American exporters compete with rivals such as China and Japan. Analysts have already settled on a name, the “Mar-a-Lago Accord,” after Trump’s private club in Palm Beach, Florida.
title: What a ‘Mar-a-Lago Accord’ Would Mean for the Dollar

description: Billionaire Steve Feinberg, President Donald Trump’s pick to be No 2 at the Pentagon, said his background in private equity investing makes him the ideal candidate to fix long-festering problems there.
title: Billionaire Feinberg Says Pentagon Needs an Investor’s Savvy

description: The case went forward, but the unusual request has contributed to a growing sense of unease inside the agency’s enforcement division, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: SEC Official Sought Staff’s No-Politics Pledge on Musk Lawsuit

description: Brazil’s finance chief said he has received the mission to balance public accounts directly from President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, whom many investors see as unwilling to make the painful spending cuts that goal demands.
title: Brazil Finance Chief Says Lula Ordered Him to Fix Budget

description: Iran’s Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi said his country won’t agree to direct nuclear talks with the US while President Donald Trump persists with his hard-line policy against the Islamic Republic.
title: Iran Rejects Direct Nuclear Talks With US Under Trump Policy

description: Germany’s Social Democrats indicated they’re open to the idea of financing a big increase in military spending by either loosening rules restricting government borrowing or creating another special fund.
title: Germany’s Social Democrats Open to €200 Billion Defense Fund

description: Hidden ship-to-ship transfers free up tankers, but have yet to aid deliveries
title: Russia Steps Up Covert Cargo Transfers to Keep Its Oil Moving

description: Mired in a seemingly never-ending series of economic crises, Argentina has, grudgingly, been exporting its top soccer players for decades. As passionate as the local fan base may be, the teams here simply never had enough financial might to compete with the contracts dangled by top foreign clubs.
title: The Milei Effect: Million-Dollar Contracts Lure Argentine Soccer Stars Home

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer outlined plans for a dramatic increase in UK defense spending — rising to 3% of economic output over the next decade — as European governments seek to bolster their security amid doubts over US support under Donald Trump.
title: UK Seeks to Lift Defense Budget to 3% of GDP on Russia Fears

description: Ukraine’s parliament passed a resolution on Tuesday saying President Volodymyr Zelenskiy should remain in power as long as Russia’s war continues and new elections may only be held once peace has been achieved, prompting a reaction from Elon Musk.
title: Musk Demands Ukraine Vote as Lawmakers Back Zelenskiy’s Mandate

description: Hundreds of informal traders blockaded the entrance to Malawi’s parliament on Tuesday in a protest over the rising cost of living.
title: Malawi Protesters Block Parliament Entrance Over Price Increases

description: Russia is ready to cooperate with Washington on developing rare-earth elements that the US needs, the Kremlin said amid the start of a broader thaw in relations since Donald Trump came to office.
title: Russia Floats Cooperation on Rare Earth Metals It Says US Needs

description: Global lenders including a unit of the World Bank and Asian Development Bank have slammed Pakistan for renegotiating contracts with power producers and warned the move will undermine investor confidence and future private investments.
title: World Bank Arm, ADB Criticize Pakistan Over Revising Power Deals

description: Israel wants to extend the Gaza ceasefire when it expires this weekend so as many hostages as possible can be freed — while starting to amass troops for a return to war if required.
title: Israel Seeks Gaza Truce Extension While Preparing Return to War

description: Europe’s reputation for strong health care systems took a hit in a report from the World Health Organization, which cited backsliding in key areas.
title: Health Challenges in European Region Need More Action, WHO Says

description: The chief executive officer of England’s National Health Service is stepping down just weeks after she faced political criticism over its productivity.
title: England’s NHS Chief to Leave After Criticism of Health Service

description: President Gustavo Petro put Armando Benedetti in charge of repairing the Colombian government’s relationship with Congress amid deep divisions within the leftist leader’s administration.
title: Colombia’s President Taps Ex-Venezuela Envoy as Interior Minister

description: The UK is in discussions to convene a group of European leaders for further talks about Russia’s war in Ukraine, according to people familiar with the matter, following a week of shuttle diplomacy between Paris, Washington and Kyiv.
title: UK Plans European Leaders’ Meeting to Talk Ukraine and Defense

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Puts America’s Foes Before Its Old Friends

description: The chiefs of Switzerland’s army and secret service are stepping down, according to media reports.
title: Swiss Army and Intelligence Chiefs Will Step Down, Media Reports

description: The Democratic Alliance, South Africa’s second-biggest party and a member of the country’s ruling coalition, rejected the imposition of any new taxes and called for spending cuts and reforms to accelerate economic growth to help stabilize the national budget.
title: South Africa’s DA Rejects New Taxes, Calls for Spending Cuts

description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent will meet Australian Treasurer Jim Chalmers in Washington on Tuesday, where the long-time ally’s pitch for an exemption from tariffs will be part of the agenda.
title: US Secretary Bessent to Talk Tariffs with Australia’s Treasurer Chalmers

description: Mark Carney, the front-runner in the race to become Canada’s next prime minister, squared off for the first time with his main rival Chrystia Freeland in a French-language TV debate that focused on how to handle President Donald Trump.
title: Carney, Freeland Jockey in Debate Over Who Can Be Toughest Opponent to Trump

description: US President Donald Trump said Monday he wanted to revive the Keystone XL oil pipeline, even though its developer has already walked away from the project.
title: Trump Wants Canada’s Keystone XL Oil Pipeline Built ‘Now’

description: Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth plans to visit the US military base at Guantanamo Bay in Cuba, where some undocumented migrants have been held as part of President Donald Trump’s crackdown on illegal immigration.
title: Hegseth Will Visit Guantanamo, Where Migrants Have Been Held

description: Elon Musk said that federal workers will be given a second opportunity to respond to a government-wide email detailing what they did last week, and threatened to fire any employee who doesn’t meet his demands.
title: Musk Threatens to Fire Federal Workers Who Don’t Reply to Next Email

description: Australia was unaware Chinese warships were set to conduct live-fire exercises off its east coast until its security authorities were alerted via a Virgin Australia pilot who heard radio communications about the drills, according to a top air traffic official.
title: Virgin Pilot Alerted Australia to China Navy Live-Fire Drill
